title: Who was the Greek king of Ithaca? - Quora

response.answer_text: Odysseus.  He was a legendary kind of Ithaca, and the hero of Homer's Odyssey. He also played the significance role in Homer's Iliad. He came up to the Trojan Horse plan that resulted in the destruction of Troy, and the victory of Greeks.

Odysseus. In Ancient Greece he was looked upon as one of the most righteous of men for his intelligence, cleverness, loyalty, enduring love for his wife, and pious devotion to the goddess Athena. Odysseus was spoken highly of in the moral treatises of various Greek authors for his character traits and persistence in the face of adversity.
